title: Ahri has the highest winrate in the game...
body:
aswell as the 7th highest pickrate out of 126 champs. In Diamond she has the 4th highest pickrate and highest winrate out of champs with more than 1000 games played. 

But yes, let's pretend she is balanced....and yeah I just lost to an Ahri who ended up with 23 kills and I totally feel I didn't lose to a player but rather to the champ he picked.

replies.body: How is it that you claim Ahri has the highest winrate, then cite Champion.gg but champion.gg says Heimer has the highest winrate while Ahri sits at 13th highest.

Again, why cite champion.gg if it is not the source you are using? Do you know how citing facts in an argument works?

You are only here to bitch because you lost to someone that is better than you but to protect your precious pride and feelings you are blaming the champion rather than your lack of skill compared to your opponent. Anyone reading any of your posts can come to the exact same conclusion. 

Riot themselves have stated that the game is balanced toward high level play. Therefore, champion.gg is a more valid source for winrates than lolking. Now, you have two options, keep whining on a forum full of people smart enough to invalidate your complaints and continue to look like a petty child or accept the fact that this player is better than you and move on.

I cited champion.gg to show how players who play Ahri for the first time win 52 percent of their games with her.

I have been telling people how broken Ahri is weeks ago...it has nothing to do with the recent game. Even if you go on champion.gg you see that Ahri has the 3rd highest winrate out of all midlaners while having the highest pick rate out of any midlane champs and out of all the champs that have a higher winrate than her (from all roles) only Janna has a higher pickrate than Ahri.

This has nothing to do with a single player being better, it is about a champ. You see the numbers yourself, there is no denying the fact that no other champ enjoys such a high winrate despite being picked so often, even by people who don't "main" her. If you can pick a champ you have never played in ranked before and have a 52 percent chance to win the game what does that tell you about the champ?
For comparison, Azir has like a 42 percent winrate for players who have 1-5 ranked games on him.

I've come to the conclusion that with EVERY site having all DIFFERENT statistics- including some of the same charts in the same categories- that i literally don't give a shit about non-cohesive data that changes practically every couple of hours.

Sites show statistics with different cut offs. LoLKing shows the win-rate as a whole through all divisions, while the champion gg link he posted only shows Plat+. It's not that the actual win rate are different, it's that they had different criteria for each one.
You forgot the fact LoLking has stats for NA, EU and Brazil, while Champion.gg for NA, EU and Korea.

Every time I hear any jokers like you OP that use Win Rate and Popularity as an excuse to why you lost to a certain champion, I just want to vomit.  Annie, Jinx, and Blitzcrank are not very far statically behind Ahri but whats their ban rate? Exactly.

That is the only statistic that matters.  Ahri is sitting at 5%.  Twisted Fate, of all champions has a ban rate higher then her.  Elise is at 78%, Irelia at 39%, Rengar at 52%, Viktor nearing 30%, Fizz at 26%.  

That is what you morons choose to ignore.  The fucking ban stat.
